alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 2:19PM PST until January 19 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM PST THURSDAY... * CHANGES...Extended Advisory through 7 am. * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches, except 6 to 14 inches above 7000 feet. Winds gusting up to 90 mph across Sierra ridgelines with gusts to 40 mph in the Tahoe Basin. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From 6 PM Wednesday to 4 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening commute and linger into the Thursday morning commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will be gusty on Lake Tahoe tonight with wave heights of 1 to 3 feet. Small boats, kayaks and paddle boards will be prone to capsizing and should remain off lake waters until conditions improve.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. Have your winter travel kit ready in your vehicle with food, water, clothing, blankets, flashlights, chains, etc. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
